result.execSummary:
The defendant Reinaldo Cordero Rodriguez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Fine of $2,400.00, $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge, all costs, surcharges, mandatory DNA surcharge.  To be paid out of up to 25% prison funds. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
*Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving one year Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.
To commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.
Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.   Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reinaldo Cordero Rodriguez

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   

 Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.   The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of  4 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 2 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $2400.00 and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge, to be paid out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 2 years.    Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 1 year to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.  

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 1 year initial confinement in this case.

Defendant was REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan.

Defendant Reinaldo Cordero Rodriguez in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Defendant Reinaldo Cordero Rodriguez in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter:  Vicki Bermudez.

Attorney Sergio Magana in court, defendant Reinaldo Cordero Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-30-2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Sergio Magana in court, Defendant Reinaldo Cordero Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for Tyrone Martin St. Junior for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the Criminal Justice Facility for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Sergio Magana in court, defendant Reinaldo Cordero Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reinaldo Cordero Rodriguez in court with attorney Sergio Magana.  Defendant Reinaldo Cordero Rodriguez in custody.  Michael Kessler, student intern under the supervision of Ron Dague for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sworn as interpreter:Alexandra Wirth.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by portable breathalyzers and SCRAM.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
State's moves to Strike the "Federal Repeat Offender" in the complaint. Granted by the Court.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant Reinaldo Cordero Rodriguez in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  
Defendant Reinaldo Cordero Rodriguez in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter sworn: Brenda Bartholomew  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
